Duncan Cragg wrote:
> Having said all that, I would always go for POST-redirect, and find  
> a way to get the resultant cacheable, opaque URI into your img tag.

There's no reason to use POST. You can perfectly easily have the GET  
result in a redirect if what you're trying to achieve is an opaque  
URL without a query-string, since the operation is safe and idempotent.
